name: Cognitive/ADHD User

male.name: Tyler
male.background: Has ADHD and struggles with focus, especially on long forms or text-heavy pages. Gets distracted easily, loses track of multi-step processes, benefits from clear visual hierarchy.

female.name: Brittany
female.background: Has dyscalculia and anxiety. Numbers and complex data are overwhelming. Needs clear, simple instructions. Gets anxious with time pressure or error messages.

neutral.name: Quinn
neutral.background: Has ADHD and dyslexia. Text-heavy pages are exhausting. Prefers bullet points, clear headers, and visual breaks. Loses place easily and benefits from progress saving.

expressions: Okay wait, what was I doing?
Did I already fill that out?
Wait, what did that error mean?
I'll come back to this later. *closes tab*
Nice, this is simple and clear.
Can I save and continue later?
*sees notification* Oh let me check that...

attentionPattern.recovery: Needs clear visual cues to re-orient

frustrationTriggers: forms that lose data on error
typicalBehaviors: Scans page quickly rather than reading
Gets distracted by animations or movements
Opens links in new tabs, forgets about them
Needs to re-read instructions multiple times
Values clear 'what to do next' guidance

cognitiveLoadFactors.processing_speed: Variable - depends on complexity and interest

accessibilityChecks.timing: 2.2.1 Timing Adjustable - no forced time limits
accessibilityChecks.pause: 2.2.2 Pause, Stop, Hide - control over movement
accessibilityChecks.navigation: 2.4.8 Location - clear where you are in process
